import pandas as pd

def main():
    # Get user input for city and line of business
    city = "ANTIOCH"  # From user prompt
    line_of_business = "Commercial"  # Implied from "commercial" in prompt
    
    # Load membership predictions data
    membership_df = dataframes_dict['membership_predictions_0221.csv']
    
    # Filter for the specified city and line of business
    filtered_membership = membership_df[
        (membership_df['MJR_AREA_NM'] == city) & 
        (membership_df['LINE_OF_BUSINESS'] == line_of_business.upper())
    ]
    
    # Load PMPM data for commercial locations
    pmpm_df = dataframes_dict['pmpm_and_2025_forecast.xlsx']['pmpm_commercial_by_location']
    
    # Select the month and city columns
    pmpm_values = pmpm_df[['Month', city]]
    
    # Ensure we have 12 months of data (assuming chronological order)
    pmpm_values = pmpm_values.head(12)
    
    # Merge the PMPM data with membership predictions
    # Assuming both dataframes are in chronological order and have 12 months
    result_df = pd.DataFrame({
        'Month': pmpm_values['Month'],
        'PMPM': pmpm_values[city],
        'Predicted_Membership': filtered_membership['predicted_mean'].values[:12]
    })
    
    # Calculate revenue
    result_df['Revenue'] = result_df['PMPM'] * result_df['Predicted_Membership']
    
    return result_df[['Month', 'PMPM', 'Predicted_Membership', 'Revenue']]
